name: 马丁·沃尔
introduction: In Australia Martin's been a series regular in a string of television series such as 'Home & Away' (Logie: Australian equivalent of BAFTA or EMMY)(Logie Nomination: 'Most Popular New Talent') 'Satisfaction', 'Underbelly - A Tale of Two Cities' (Logie Winner: Best New Series), 'Rescue Special Ops', and starred in his own police drama 'COPS L.A.C.' Martin won the 'Best Actor' Award in 2014 for his performance in 'We Men Do', he Produced & Starred in the feature film 'The Nothing Men' (Nominated for Panavision Spirit Award for Independent Cinema at The Santa Barbara International Film Festival) Starred alongside Nicole Kidman & Joseph Fiennes in 'Strangerland' (Sundance Competition) played the Romantic Lead of American Movie Star Michael Barclay in the film 'All that Jam' shot entirely on location in Russia, for which Martin learned & spoke the entire film in Russian. He then filmed the lead role of Warren Novac in the action, thriller 'Happy Hunting' (Winner 'Best Actor', 'Best Film', 'Audience Choice Award', 'Best Cinematography') which sits on the prestigious Thrillist at No. 13 for Best Horror Films of 2017. Martin then went to Chile to film Gun Shy with Antonio Banderas & Olga Kurylenko Directed by Simon West. Martin's next project (2018) is the Lead Role in the series 'First List' shot on location in Los Angeles playing Will Scott, ex FBI field Agent & the agencies eminent cryptographer.
